Scenario: You are on the street outside your apartment building.  It looks so weird with all the walkways going the same direction!  Even at commute, there was always one lane to go the other way!
Response A: I proceed to the next major intersection on my own
Response B: I proceed to the next major intersection--oh, there's my neighbor, I should say "hi!"
Response C: I proceed to the next major intersection-chatting up a complete stranger

Scenario: You reach the next major intersection, where you want to turn to head for the shuttleport.  This road is much wider--but still all going one-way!
Response A: I stop for a bit to decide
Response B: I don't need to stop--it's obvious I want to go down the street!
Response C: I turn up the main street, chatting with a different person

Scenario: Your neighbor says "Wow, I can't believe we're all leaving today!  I wasn't expecting it for weeks!"
Response A: I agree, and keep chatting aimlessly, until I get to the next intersection
Response B: I decide that a complete stranger might be more interesting to talk to.
Response C: I listen to my neighbor politely, but are happy to split up at the next intersection when she sees someone else to talk at.

Scenario: After a few remarks on things like it being amazing you're all leaving, the stranger asks if you've heard the latest rumor--you, of course, say, "No", and she explains that she's heard that the planet isn't really going to be destroyed, the government sold it to the aliens!
Response A: I'm astonished--I wonder if it is true?
Response B: I reply that seems unlikely, and we proceed up the street
Response C: I believe her--better get to that spaceport fast!

Scenario: When you pause, several people bump into you from behind, saying "Hey, why'd you stop?"
Response A: I apologize and turn into the major street
Response B: I apologize and strike up a conversation with them as we turn and continue our journey
Response C: I curse at them and walk off in a huff

Scenario: You are walking along when a chatty person says to you "Have you heard about Shokugaki?  I hear there's 8 foot spiders that live there!"
Response B: I say "That HAS to be a scare story!"
Response C: I say "wait, I thought it was pretty unexplored?"

Scenario: You chat for a bit with the people, swapping planet rumors.  They tell you they've heard that the natives/aliens on Mizar 3 fart a lot.
Response A: I say "Well, can't stink as badly as Endo Delta, right?"
Response B: I say "I heard those aliens can read your mind!"

Scenario: "Well, I don't know--guess some people will see!  I'm happy, I'm headed for Endo Delta!"
Response A: As he moves off, I think "Ah, yes, Endo Delta, aka "Emotionally Disturbed!"
Response B: As he moves off, I wonder if he's worried about the reports of horrible smells on Endo Delta.  Or maybe that's just a horrible rumor, too
Response C: As he moves off, I think this is an excellent candidate for the planet nicknamed "Wacko Planet"!

Scenario: They laugh, and you continue trading stories--they tell you about the rumors that the government has been shipping the mentally ill people to Endo Delta for years now, and one city is simply full of them. It doesn't seem like anyone's actually believing that one, so you laugh, too, and keep chatting as we walk up the road
